Job Title: Risk and Safety Manager

Location: Tannersville, PA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Title: Risk and Safety ManagerDepartment: Loss PreventionReports to: Director of Risk and Safety
The Risk and Safety Manager is responsible for the various areas within Risk and Safety to include, audits inspections, workers comp and general liability claims management, and assist with ongoing safety efforts at Camelback Resort for guest and employees. The Manager will manage the payroll, scheduling and assignments of Risk and Safety coordinator. Follow directives from the Director of Risk and Safety What’s in it for me:Complimentary access to Camelbeach, Camelback, Aquatopia, local amusement parks and more Plus, great friends & family perks.Paid Training to gain skills, knowledge, and experience for professional development.Not to be missed employee events throughout the season.Referral Bonuses – invite your friends to work with you!Competitive wages and advancement opportunities.Interact with people from all over the world!Next day pay, through PayActiv.Tuition Reimbursement*Medical, dental, vision insurance, 401K*Vacation and PTO**Full-Time status benefits  How I can create Guests for Life: Work closely with the departments, contractors, and Loss Prevention members to reduce hazards and improve safety performance.Conduct safety inspections/walkthroughs and monitor department activities.Champion the completion of safety related requirements, including Incident reporting, JSA (Job Safety Analysis), LOTO (Lock Out/Tag Out) procedures, and CS (Confined Space) entry documentation, SDS and facility chemical inventory. Assistance includes training, and teamwork as appropriate.Follow up on all issues arising out of new accidents involving Guests using root cause analysis and science-based decision making to adjust operations and minimize a reoccurrence.Tracking of incident metrics, analyzing trends of incidents/injuries using root cause analysis and science-based decision making, and present recommendations of corrective actions to the Director of Risk and Safety.Prepare and conduct safety training sessions.Prepare and conduct safety portions of daily, weekly, monthly, and seasonal Service Guidelines and Checklists.Assist safety, claims management and regulatory compliance efforts, with testing, tracking, and reporting as necessary.Manage the following Safety Programs:Contractor Safety ProgramCreate and maintain the policy and procedures.Track and record certificates of insurance.Ensure that contractors are OSHA compliant.Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) ProgramMaintain the PPE Matrix by department.Quarterly audit tracking of all PPE.Train the Safety and Risk Coordinator to maintain and audit.Job Safety Analysis (JSA) ProgramRecord and update JSA’s by department with the assistance of the Safety Committee.Safety CommitteeAssist the Director of Risk and Safety with leading the Safety Committee.Help department representatives with JSA’s, PPE, safety audits and all other safety initiatives.Develop appropriate safety training for the Designated Coach Program.Assist the Director of Risk and Safety with any other safety initiatives and programs.Ability to conduct inspections and audits to evaluate the safety protocols followed throughout the resort to protect guest and employees.Assist with the Safety Committee and Chairpersons on developing the safety culture with behavior-based safety approach.Attend regular meetings with claims, attorneys, and insurance partners to discuss updates on claims.Manage the distribution of ice trekkers during the winter season to all associates. Is this the job for me:Experience with claims management (GL/WC).Experience with behavior-based safety programs.Detail oriented with exceptional organizational skills for managing of files.Education, training and or experience with OSHA, Fire Life Safety, EPA and other Risk and Safety related organizations.Managing of multiple projects and initiatives.  This job description is to be considered a general outline of the duties and responsibilities of this position and is subject to changes and revisions by Camelback Resort at any time. Responsibilities are listed as guidelines only and the job is not necessarily limited to these specifications.

Experience Level (if available): None
